channel.title: History of Arsenal Football Club | The Invincibles | 12 FA Cup wins
channel.description: A history of all the famous moments for the Arsenal Football Club. Going unbeaten in 2003/2004 which immortalised Arsenal FC.

item.title: Arsenal 3-0 Manchester United
item.description: Arsenal stunned Manchester United by scoring 3 goals in 20 minutes to end the contest. Goals from Ozil and Sanchez completed the win.

item.title: Arsenal 4-0 Aston Villa
item.description: Arsenal win the FA Cup for a record 12 times, punishing Aston Villa 4-0. A wonder goal from Alexis Sanchez put Arsenal in command after Theo Walcott's opener. Per Mertesacker and Olivier Giroud completed the rout.

item.title: Arsenal 4-1 Liverpool
item.description: Arsenal blitz liverpool with 3 goals within 8 minutes to secure all three points. Goals from Bellerin, Ozil and Sanchez set Arsenal on their way

item.title: Arsenal 3-2 Hull
item.description: Arsenal staged an incredible fightback after being 2-0 down within 10 minutes against Hull. Santi Cazorla's wonderful freekick put Arsenal back in contention before Koscielny equalised shortly before full time. Aaron Ramsey scored the winner in extra time.

item.title: Arsenal 7-3 Newcastle United
item.description: Arsenal hit 7 as a crazy game saw Theo Walcott score a hat trick. Arsenal and Newcastle were tied at 3-3 until Arsenal finally broke away.

item.title: Arsenal 5-2 Tottenham Hotspur
item.description: Arsenal put in a 5 star performance to crush fierce rivals Tottenham 5-2. Adebayor opened the scoring before a reckless tackle saw him sent off. Mertesacker equalised before Podolski and Giroud set Arsenal on their way to a memorable victory.

item.title: Reading 5-7 Arsenal
item.description: Arsenal mount an incredible comeback from being 4-0 down to win 7-5 in extra time. A hat trick from Theo Walcott helped Arsenal recover from an impossible situation.

item.title: Arsenal 5-2 Tottenham Hotspur
item.description: Arsenal stunned Spurs with a magnificent comeback after being 2-0 down early on. A Sagna header and a magnificent long ranger from Van Persie saw Arsenal level at half time. Rosicky put Arsenal ahead and a double from Walcott sent the gunners fans wild.

item.title: Liverpool 3-6 Arsenal
item.description: A stunning performance from Arsenal's youngsters as Julio Baptista hits 4 against Liverpool. Aliadiere and Song scored the other goals.

item.title: Arsenal 5-4 Manchester United
item.description: Arsenal win the FA Cup for the 10th time with a penalty shootout victory over Manchester United. Arsenal were on the back foot for the majority of the game with Patrick Vieira scoring the crucial penalty.

item.title: Arsenal 3-1 Aston Villa
item.description: Arsenal set a record 49 games unbeaten seeing off Aston Villa 3-1. Villa took a shock lead through Hendrie before Robert Pires equalised from the penalty spot. Thierry Henry gave Arsenal the lead before Pires wrapped things up.

item.title: Everton 1-4 Arsenal
item.description: Arsenal start the defence of their title with a convincing win over Everton

item.title: Arsenal 2-1 Leicester City
item.description: Arsenal became the first team to win the Premier League unbeaten. Goals from Thierry Henry and Patrick Vieira secured the win over Leicester City.

item.title: Leeds 1-4 Arsenal
item.description: Arsenal sweep past Leeds with an outstanding attacking display

item.title: Arsenal 1-0 Southampton
item.description: Arsenal beat southampton 1-0 to secure their 9th FA Cup. An early Robert Pires goal secured the cup.

item.title: Leeds 1-4 Arsenal
item.description: A double from Kanu gave Arsenal a comprehensive 1-4 victory over Leeds United.

item.title: Manchester United 0-1 Arsenal
item.description: A famous night for Arsenal as Sylvan Wiltord scored the only goal to secure the title at Old Trafford and complete another famous double.

item.title: Arsenal 2-0 Chelsea
item.description: Stunning goals from Ray Parlour and Freddie Ljungberg gave Arsenal a 2-0 victory over Chelsea. That was Arsenal's 8th FA Cup victory.

item.title: Arsenal 3-1 Juventus
item.description: Arsenal beat a strong Juventus side with a double from Freddie Ljungberg

item.title: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal
item.description: Arsenal stunned Chelsea with a hat trick from Kanu in the last 15 minutes to win 3-2 at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: Arsenal 4-0 Everton
item.description: A comfortable victory for Arsenal gave Arsene Wenger his first trophy for Arsenal. An own goal frim Bilic and a double from Overmars set Arsenal on their way before the captain Tony Adams sealed the 4-0 victory

item.title: Arsenal 2-0 Newcastle United
item.description: Arsene Wenger's second trophy came straight after winning the league as he recorded a well deserved FA Cup victory over Newcastle United. Goals from Anelka and Overmars sealed the victory and Arsenal's 7th FA Cup.

item.title: Arsenal 5-0 Wimbledon
item.description: Arsenal thrash Wimbledon with 5 different goalscorers

item.title: Blackburn 1-4 Arsenal
item.description: Arsenal brushed aside title rivals Blackburn with a scintillating first half display.

item.title: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal
item.description: A Nigel Winterburn stunner gave Arsenal the three points against Chelsea

item.title: Arsenal 1-0 Parma
item.description: One of Arsenal's most famous nights in Europe. against all odds Arsenal Beat Parma 1-0 thanks to Alan Smith's fabulous volley

item.title: Arsenal 2-1 Sheffield Wednesday
item.description: Steve Morrow got the extra time winner which won the League cup for Arsenal after coming from behind against Sheffield Wednesday.

item.title: Arsenal 2-1 Sheffield Wednesday
item.description: Andy Linighan was the hero in extra time for Arsenal as he scored the crucial header to win Arsenal the FA Cup.

item.title: Arsenal 3-1 Manchester United
item.description: Alan Smith scored a hat trick which gave Arsenal a 3-1 victory over Manchester United to secure the league title.

item.title: Liverpool 0-2 Arsenal
item.description: The most memorable league victory for Arsenal as they needed to win by two clear goals at Anfield against the Champions Liverpool. Michael Thomas scored in injury time to give Arsenal a 2-0 win after Alan Smith opened the scoring.
